context: The Estonian word 'moodus' is a noun that means way, method, manner, mode or style. It refers to the manner in which something is done or the way of doing something. The dictionary definition shows it has several meanings including 1) viis, laad (way, manner/style), 2) kõneviis (mood/mode in grammar), and 3) filosofiline olemisviis (philosophical mode of being). In the example sentences provided, 'moodus' is used to refer to different methods or ways of doing things - specifically teaching methods, relaxation techniques, and ways of getting information. The word appears in the genitive plural form ('mooduseid') in most examples, indicating it's referring to multiple methods or ways.
